posts.post_content:
Makes sense flavourfully when you think about it. He's so consumed with Liliana that he's let his guard down. His focus isn't on his own survival, it's dealing with Vess, ala him rushing headlong into a battle with his first ability. He doesn't care how he deals with what's in front of him, it's that he is able to press on unhindered, even at the cost of his well being. Even his summoning powers have weakened. It's interesting how his loyalty abilities don't increase or decrease upon activation either. Sort of like he just doesn't care.
  
   
It makes me think that Wizards actually plans these things out.
posts.html:

He doesn't care how he deals with what's in front of him, it's that he is able to press on unhindered, even at the cost of his well being. Even his summoning powers have weakened. It's interesting how his loyalty abilities don't increase or decrease upon activation either. Sort of like he just doesn't care.

It makes me think that Wizards actually plans these things out.

Posted By: .Blaze. (9/22/2011 10:17:18 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This is probably the worst planeswalker ever printed. You're forced to (most of the time) go down to 1 loyalty to flip him, and once you do his abilities are completely underwhelming. +1 stalls the ground board in limited, but it seems like it wouldn't be too much of a problem in constructed. -1 is the poor man's fauna shaman/survival, and his last ability is 90% of the time going to be a pathetically small Overwhelming Stampede.
posts.html:

5/5

posts.post_content:
Awful against Red, given that it dies to [Incinerate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incinerate) and, after using his fight ability, to [Shock](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shock). Not sure how it would work against other colors.
  
It would also be hylarious to see someone casting [Titanic Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Titanic Growth) or whatever other instant pump on their creature in response to their opponent activating Garruk's first ability, so the aforementioned creature eats Garruk's head (and survives to brag about it).
  
Another bad thing that could happen to him would be [Invisible Stalker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Invisible Stalker) attacking him after he transforms. That wouldn't be cool, would it?
  
Anyway, I'm not sure why I'm being so mean about this card. It could be that there have been already two other Garruks printed recently ([Garruk, Primal Hunter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk, Primal Hunter) in M12 and [Garruk Wildspeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Garruk Wildspeaker) in Commander), both of which are cooler and more playable, or that I really hate this new transform mechanic, or that he's a Mythic Ra... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Awful against Red, given that it dies to Incinerate and, after using his fight ability, to Shock. Not sure how it would work against other colors.
It would also be hylarious to see someone casting Titanic Growth or whatever other instant pump on their creature in response to their opponent activating Garruk's first ability, so the aforementioned creature eats Garruk's head (and survives to brag about it).
Another bad thing that could happen to him would be Invisible Stalker attacking him after he transforms. That wouldn't be cool, would it?
Anyway, I'm not sure why I'm being so mean about this card. It could be that there have been already two other Garruks printed recently (Garruk, Primal Hunter in M12 and Garruk Wildspeaker in Commander), both of which are cooler and more playable, or that I really hate this new transform mechanic, or that he's a Mythic Ra...
